channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Euro zone economic growth remains sluggish in August, PMI shows
FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks rise amid global bond sell-off while gold hits fresh highs
IDF kills head of Mujahideen terror group in Gaza, which held Bibas family hostage
Russia says it will help China overtake the United States on nuclear power
Donald Trump Fires Off Stark Warning To Xi, Putin And Kim Jong Un: ‘As You Conspire Against Us…’
9/2: The Daily Report
item.description: Jericka Duncan reports on President Trump's plans to send troops to major U.S. cities, and why climate experts are criticizing the Energy Department.

item.title: 1 killed, 3 injured in Wyoming mountains plane crash
item.description: A small plane carrying four passengers crashed in mountainous terrain in Northern Wyoming, Monday, killing a 13-year-old girl and injuring three relat...

item.title: Trump cannot use Alien Enemies Act to deport members of Venezuelan gang, appeals court rules
Russia bombards western Ukraine prompting Poland to scramble NATO jets
item.description: Russia launched more than 500 drones and missiles into Ukraine overnight into Wednesday morning, according to Ukraine's air force.

item.title: 9/2: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump says “we’re going in” when asked about possibly sending troops to Chicago; New book looks at the intelligence battle between Russia and the U.S.

item.title: Robert E. Lee portrait back up in West Point's library

item.title: D.C. grand jurors reject latest wave of Justice Dept. indictment requests
item.description: One former federal prosecutor said of the indictment denials by D.C. grand juries that he's "never heard of this happening."

item.title: Survivors of Maine mass shooting and victims’ relatives sue US government alleging negligence
Plane crashes in Wyoming mountains, killing girl and injuring family
item.description: A medical helicopter spotted the downed aircraft after its crew was asked to fly over the area in Bighorn National Forest.

item.title: WATCH: Wedding crasher steals $60,000 in gifts to bride and groom
item.description: Police are searching for a wedding crasher who stole about $60,000 in cash and checks intended for a Southern California bride and groom.
